turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Citalopram.
turn.2: Citalopram was first synthesized in 1972 by chemist Klaus Bøgesø and his research group at the pharmaceutical company Lundbeck and was first marketed in 1989 in Denmark.
turn.3: When was it made available in the US?
turn.4: It was first marketed in the US in 1998.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The patent expired in 2003, allowing other companies to legally produce generic versions.
turn.7: What are some of the brand names?
turn.8: Citalopram is sold under these brand-names: On 19 June 2013, the European Commission imposed a fine of €93.8 million on the Danish pharmaceutical company Lundbeck, plus a total of €52.2 million on several generic pharmaceutical-producing companies.
turn.10: This was in response to Lundbeck entering an agreement with the companies to delay their sales of generic citalopram after Lundbeck's patent on the drug had expired, thus reducing competition in breach of European antitrust law.
